item.title: Florida shooting suspect struggled with mental health: family
item.description: The man police say opened fire with a gun from his checked baggage at a Florida airport had a history of mental health issues -- some of which followed his military service in Iraq -- and was receiving psychological treatment at his home in Alaska, his relatives said Friday after the deadly shooting.
item.dc:creator: Jason Dearen
item.enclosure: Esteban Santiago, the 26-year-old man police say opened fire with a gun from his checked baggage at a Florida airport, is seen in this image.

item.title: Suspected gunman picked off passengers, sent crowds fleeing
item.description: Without a word, the gunman moved through the baggage claim picking off travellers until his handgun ran out of ammunition, leaving five dead and eight wounded in Fort Lauderdale's airport.
item.dc:creator: David Fischer
item.enclosure: Passengers run for cover in Terminal 1 at Fort Lauderdaleâ€“Hollywood International Airport, Friday, Jan. 6, 2017, in Fort Lauderdale, Fla. (Paul E. Kostyu via AP)

item.title: Florida attack updates: Fort Lauderdale airport reopens after shooting
item.description: Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport has reopened following the terminal shooting that left five people dead and eight wounded.
item.enclosure: Passengers run as they evacuate from Terminal 1 at Fort Lauderdaleâ€šÃ„Ã¬Hollywood International Airport in Fort Lauderdale, Fla., Friday, Jan. 6, 2017. (Paul E. Kostyu via AP)

item.title: Exclusive: Top Trudeau advisers have high-level meetings with Trump officials
item.description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeauâ€™s top advisers have had about a dozen high-level meetings with President-elect Donald Trumpâ€™s most trusted officials, CTV News has learned.
item.dc:creator: Laura Payton
item.enclosure: In this March 16, 2016 file photo, Trump Tower is seen in New York. (AP Photo/Mark Lennihan, File)

item.title: Ont. man clocked at 218 kph charged with stunt driving: police
item.description: A Thornhill man is facing a stunt driving charge after provincial police in Richmond Hill say they clocked him doing 218 kph in a 100 zone.
item.enclosure: Undated file photo of Highway 407 entrance sign.

item.title: Report on election hacking says Russia plans to do more
item.description: The new, declassified report on Russian efforts to influence the presidential election has a troublesome prediction: Russia isn't done intruding in U.S. politics and policymaking.
item.dc:creator: Deb Riechmann, Eileen Sullivan and Julia Pace
item.enclosure: A part of the declassified version Intelligence Community Assessment on Russia's efforts to interfere with the U.S. political process is photographed in Washington, Friday, Jan. 6, 2017. (AP / Jon Elswick)

item.title: Red Cross says U.K. hospital crowding a 'humanitarian crisis'
item.description: The British Red Cross says overcrowding in hospital emergency rooms has become a 'humanitarian crisis.'
item.enclosure: A bed sits empty in an operating room in Atlanta in this Friday, Jan. 24, 2014 file photo. (AP / David Goldman)

item.title: Fiat Chrysler recalls 100K vehicles to fix Takata air bags
item.description: Fiat Chrysler is recalling more than 100,000 older trucks and SUVs worldwide to replace potentially dangerous Takata air bag inflators.
item.enclosure: In this Aug. 11, 2011 file photo, a Dodge Durango is pictured at a dealership in Warren, Mich. (AP / Paul Sancya)

item.title: Taiwan leader heads to Americas; U.S. stops set to irk China
item.description: Taiwan's leader pledged to bolster her self-ruled island's presence on the international stage as she set off Saturday to visit four Central American allies on a trip that includes U.S. transits and looks set to raise China's ire.
item.dc:creator: Gillian Wong
item.enclosure: Taiwan's President Tsai Ing-wen delivers a speech before traveling to visit Central American allies including a U.S. transit, Saturday, Jan. 7, 2017, at the Taoyuan International Airport in Taouyuan, Taiwan. (Central News Agency via AP)

item.title: $60 million Lotto Max jackpot claimed by ticket sold in Quebec
item.description: The whopping $60 million jackpot in Friday night's Lotto Max draw was claimed by a single ticket sold in Quebec.
item.enclosure: A sign outside a Toronto convenience store advertises a Lotto Max draw. (Chris Kitching)
